It is possible, but you would need to add some sort of mechanism for converting to HubL when compiles the scss. <@U7UBMQMDK> and <@U26B530N6> have done this internally so one of them should be able to share a gist that demonstrates how.

It is necessary for the final format of the files to be HubL + CSS so that when the theme settings are updated via the theme editor that the css files can be regenerated with the new values.

Internally, we opted to use a scss function that took a given field’s theme names, but I don’t see why you couldn’t further abstract it by assigning to variables, too. Here’s a gist example: <https://gist.github.com/levinkeo/e233963bdfc0933a4f75b9fdcb591410>
